org.gearvrf

Class GVRCameraRig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRComponent
        • org.gearvrf.GVRCameraRig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PrettyPrint

    public class GVRCameraRig
extends GVRComponent
implements PrettyPrint
    Holds the GVRCameras.

      • getComponentType

        public static long getComponentType()

      • makeInstance

        public static GVRCameraRig makeInstance(GVRContext gvrContext)
        Constructs a camera rig with cameras attached. An owner scene object is automatically created for the camera rig. Do not try to change the owner object of the camera rig - not supported currently and will lead to native crashes.

      • attachToParent

        public void attachToParent(GVRSceneObject parentObject)

      • detachFromParent

        public void detachFromParent(GVRSceneObject parentObject)

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the rotation of the camera rig by multiplying further rotations by the inverse of the current rotation.

        Cancels the effect of prior calls to resetYaw() and resetYawPitch().

      • resetYaw

        public void resetYaw()
        Resets the yaw of the camera rig by multiplying further changes in the rig's yaw by the inverse of the current yaw.

        Cancels the effect of prior calls to reset() and resetYawPitch().

      • resetYawPitch

        public void resetYawPitch()
        Resets the yaw and pitch of the camera rig by multiplying further changes in the rig's yaw and pitch by the inverse of the current yaw and pitch.

        Cancels the effect of prior calls to reset() and resetYaw().

      • getLookAt

        public float[] getLookAt()
        The direction the camera rig is looking at. In other words, the direction of the local -z axis.
        Returns:
        Array with 3 floats corresponding to a normalized direction vector. ([0] : x, [1] : y, [2] : z)

      • getTransform

        public GVRTransform getTransform()
        Get the GVRTransform.
        Overrides:
        getTransform in class GVRComponent
        Returns:
        The current transform of owner object of camera rig. Applying transform to owner object of camera rig moves it. If no transform is currently attached to the object, returns null.

        public int getChildrenCount()
        Get the number of child objects that belongs to owner object of this camera rig.
        Returns:
        Number of objects added as children of this camera rig owner object.

      • removeAllChildren

        public void removeAllChildren()
        Remove all children that have been added to the owner object of this camera rig; except the camera objects.

      • getHeadTransform

        public GVRTransform getHeadTransform()
        Get the head transform for setting sensor data. In contrast, use getTransform() for additional camera positioning, such as the game character moving and turning.
        Returns:
        The head transform object.

      • getNearClippingDistance

        public float getNearClippingDistance()
        Returns:
        Distance from the origin to the near clipping plane for the camera rig.

        Parameters:
